citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Physical oceanography of the Strait of Juan de Fuca, 1998-present

descript.abstract: Physical oceanographic observations used to construct models of circulation in the Strait of Juan de Fuca.
descript.purpose: Constructing a model of circulation in the Strait of Juan de Fuca.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Data are in electronic format, well backed up and well documented. Risk of Loss: Low Impact Justification: Does not affect a wide variety of users. Impact of Loss: Low Recommended Action: None

place.placekey: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Some data have not been quality checked.

dataqual.logic: CTD data processed using normal IOS processing procedures. Normal standardization of CTD instruments at IOS.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: The accuracy of the CTD data may vary depending on the instruments used and whether collaborating data were collected for intercomparison purposes. Guildline CTDs are standardized at IOS; Sea-Bird CTD`s are calibrated at Sea-Bird Electronics in Bellevue, Washington. Electronic Data Complications: Null

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Joseph Linguanti, Rm 1246, IOS Hardcopy Description: Various log books, data reports, cruise reports, and data sheets. Hardcopy Volume: Several hundred (entire archive)
stdorder.ordering: Data will become available after the proprietary period. Contact data custodian.
Electronic Data Doc Locations: Header information in each file and additional processing notes in data directory Dataset Locations: DATA_LIBRARY:
